channel.title: How do you cause a windows blue screen with batch?
channel.description:
sometimes my teachers leave their accounts logged in, they can run bat files
does someone know a way of causing the windows blue screen of death to come up with a batch file?
people who use linux claim that this happen every two seconds, so this should be an easy question to answer. :)
iv tried using the file tskill.exe which ends the specified process [code]tskill * [/code] although it ends explorer.exe, it doesnt cause anything shocking enough :(
id prefer not to delete anything, but if deleting system files is the only way, then so be it. if thats the case, please tell me which system files to delete

item.title: How do you cause a windows blue screen with batch?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

wow nice find Bebe
pity i cant use it at school, we cant get onto regedit

keep the ideas coming please, ill try h44ckzor pwnage’s and tell you how it goes

Read full topic
item.source: How do you cause a windows blue screen with batch?

item.title: How do you cause a windows blue screen with batch?
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

Found this on http://pcsupport.about.com/od/tipstricks/ht/makebsodxp.htm

[ul][li]Click on Start and then Run.[/li]
[li]In the text box in the Run window, type regedit and click OK. This will open the Registry Editor program.[/li]
[li]Locate the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE folder under My Computer and click on the (+) sign next the folder name to expand the folder.[/li]
[li]Continue to expand folders until you reach the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\i8042prt registry key.[/li]
[li]Select the Parameters key under i8042prt.[/li]
[li]From the menu, select Edit, then New and finally DWORD Value.[/li]
[li]On the right-hand side of the screen, a new value will appear. Name this new value CrashOnCtrlScroll. The value must be named this exactly to function properly.[/li]
[li]Double-click on the CrashOnCtrlScroll DWORD value you just created and set the Value data to 1.[/li]
[li]Click OK and then close Registry Editor.[/li]
[li]Restart your PC and log back in as you normally do.[/li]
[li]To create the BSOD, press and hold the Ctrl key on the right side of the keyboard while you press the Scroll Lock key twice in quick succession.[/li][/ul]

Warning: Your system will lock up and need to be restarted after causing the BSOD so make sure any work you are doing is saved and all programs are closed before initiating the keystrokes above.

The BSOD will appear on screen.

I don’t know if this will help you any :o

Read full topic
item.source: How do you cause a windows blue screen with batch?

item.title: How do you cause a windows blue screen with batch?
item.dc:creator: @h44ckzor_pwnage h44ckzor pwnage
item.description:
@h44ckzor_pwnage wrote:

Well I don’t know about a blue screen but delete Ntoskrnl.exe in C>Windows>System32 and it will give you a black and white screen saying they need a new copy of the file.
